admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
trustfund:
TF023615-KOREAN CONSULTANT TRUST FUND,TF034397-THAILAND - SEC. EDUCATION
            QUALITY IMPROVEMENT PROJECT II

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory.
            Prospects for sustaining the project's outcomes are
            highly likely. Overall the performances of the World Bank
            and the Borrower are assessed as satisfactory. Key lessons
            from this project are: 1) Early identification of
            implementation problems, and Borrower commitment to
            aggressively address those issues were key factors to the
            success of its outcomes. 2) Strong identification teams with
            extensive project design experience offer more assurance
            that estimates of implementation capacity, costs, and
            expected outcomes are accurate and articulated with national
            priorities and Bank policies. 3) Future operations should
            establish a Performance Management Framework to provide
            early and continuous assessment of both outcomes and project
            impacts on stakeholders. This should include evaluations to
            measure the effect of investments in capacity building,
            improved training facilities and better trained staff, and
            the cost effectiveness of public sector training. 4) Bank
            projects have to be better planned and coordinated
            especially because project management is made more complex
            in matrix organizations.
